intro: Streptanthus callistus, commonly known as the golden stalked winter cress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, and its leaves are alternate, simple, and often hairy. Streptanthus callistus is typically found in open, rocky habitats and thrives in well-drained soils. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest to botanists due to its ecological and evolutionary significance.
